title: Wordpress asking for FTP credentials
body:
### The symptom

I tried to delete Hello Dolly and WordPress asked me for FTP credentials to perform the action.

### The cause(s)

#### Directory permissions/ownership

The WordPress directory wasn’t owned by Nginx. I fixed that quickly by `cd`ing into the directory of my WordPress installation and doing:

```
chown -R nginx:nginx . 
```

#### Process ownership

The above didn’t resolve it though. As it happens PHP was running under a different user that didn’t have permission to access the files directly. In my case, `php-fpm` was running under `apache`, which it seems is the default configuration upon installation. I edited `/etc/php-fpm.d/www.conf` and changed:

```
; RPM: apache Choosed to be able to access some dir as httpd
user = apache

; RPM: Keep a group allowed to write in log dir.
group = apache
```

To this:

```
; RPM: apache Choosed to be able to access some dir as httpd
user = nginx

; RPM: Keep a group allowed to write in log dir.
group = nginx
```

Then restarted `php-fpm`:

```
sudo service php-fpm restart`
```

All sorted. No more request for FTP credentials. Now I can get on with more interesting things, like installing and playing with the [JSON API](https://wordpress.org/plugins/json-api/) plugin.
